member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.Errors
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.AttemptToConnectSources
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A connection between two different sources is not allowed..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.CannotConnectDirectly
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The path contains a leg with two channels that cannot be directly connected..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.CannotConnectToItself
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A channel cannot be connected to itself..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.Channel1Name
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Channel 1 name: .

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.Channel2Name
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Channel 2 name: .

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ChannelDuplicatedInLeg
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The two channels in the leg are the same..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ChannelDuplicatedInPath
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A channel name is duplicated in the path..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ChannelName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Channel name: .

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ChannelsAlreadyConnected
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A leg in the path contains two channels that are already directly connected..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.EmptyScanList
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No scan list is specified..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.EmptySwitchPath
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The switch path is empty..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ExplicitConnectionExists
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An explicit connection between the channels already exists..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.InvalidScanList
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The given scan list string does not have the correct syntax, or the scan list syntax cannot be implemented by the switch..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.IsConfigurationChannel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An explicit connection to a configuration channel is not allowed..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.NoScanInProgress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The switch is not currently scanning through the scan list..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.NoSuchPath
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No explicit path exists between the channels..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.NotAConfigurationChannel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to One of the non-terminal channels in the path is not a configuration channel..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.PathNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No path was found between the channels..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ResourceInUse
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to One of the channels in the path is a configuration channel that is in use..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ScanInProgress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The switch is currently scanning through the scan list..

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.Errors.ScanList
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Scan list: .

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant scan interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.ConfigureList(System.String,Ivi.Swtch.ScanMode)
member.summary: Sets a scan list that specifies actions to take while scanning, the scan mode for the list, and the order in which the actions are executed. The format of this array is described in the IviSwtch specification.
member.param: A complete array list of actions to be performed while scanning. The array must be a complete list because the driver does not expose a reference to the array for additional modifications.
Scanning mode.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.ConfigureTrigger(Ivi.Driver.PrecisionTimeSpan,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Configures the scan Delay, Input trigger, and ScannerAdvancedOutput trigger properties, in order to set the trigger behavior for the scan list established with the ConfigureList method.
member.param: The minimum length of time you want the instrument to wait from the time the instrument creates a path until it asserts a trigger on the Scan Advanced output line. The driver uses this value to set the Scan Delay property. See the property description for more details.

Each driver determines what values are valid based on the capabilities of supported instruments. The IVI Foundation defines a set of standard trigger values in IVI-3.3, Standard Cross Class Capabilities. If the driver supports one of the sources documented in IVI-3.3, it must support the standard string value for that source.
Scan advanced output. The driver uses this value to set the Scan Advanced Output property. See the property description for more details.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Initiate
member.summary: Initiates the scan based on the current List property, and returns once the scan has begun. To stop scanning, call Abort. When the switch is scanning, operations other than reading properties, SendSoftwareTrigger and Abort are invalid.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Abort
member.summary: Stops the scan that begun with Initiate method and returns the switch to the Idle state. This operation does not reset or initialize the state of the switch. To determine the status of the scan, call the IsScanning method.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.SendSoftwareTrigger
member.summary: Sends a software trigger, which causes the switch to advance to the next entry in the scan List.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.WaitForScanComplete(Ivi.Driver.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits up to maxTime for the instrument to stop scanning through the scan List.
member.param: Maximum time to wait for the scan to complete.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.List
member.summary: A scan list that specifies actions to take while scanning, and the order in which the actions are executed. The format of this string is described in the IviSwtch specification.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.IsScanning
member.summary: If True, the switch module is currently scanning through the scan list.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Continuous
member.summary: If True, the switch module should scan continuously through the scan list, otherwise it should only scan once through the scan list.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.NumberOfColumns
member.summary: The maximum number of channels on the column of a matrix or scanner. If the switch module is a scanner, this value is the number of input channels. The number returned is dependent on the WireMode property.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.NumberOfRows
member.summary: The maximum number of channels on the row of a matrix or scanner. If the switch module is a scanner, this value is the number of output channels (commons). The number returned is dependent on the WireMode property.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.ScannerAdvancedOutput
member.summary: The destination of the scan's advanced output trigger. This trigger is asserted each time a path is created. [Refer to the instrument driver documentation for valid values, which may include one or more of the standard values defined in Ivi.Driver.TriggerSource.]

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Delay
member.summary: The minimum length of time from creating the path to asserting the scan's advanced output trigger. The actual time may be longer.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Input
member.summary: The source of the trigger input. Input triggers tell the switch module to advance to the next entry in the scan list and close the specified channel. [Refer to the instrument driver documentation for valid values, which may include one or more of the standard values defined in Ivi.Driver.TriggerSource.]

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchScan.Mode
member.summary: The connection breaking behavior of the switch during a scan. Previous paths may be broken before making new ones, after making new ones, or not broken at all.

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtch
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant root level interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtch.Channels
member.summary: A reference to the class-compliant IIviSwtchChannels interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtch.Path
member.summary: A reference to the class-compliant IIviSwtchPath interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtch.Scan
member.summary: A reference to the class-compliant IIviSwtchScan interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchChannel
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant channel interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchChannel.IsConfigurationChannel
member.summary: If True, the channel is no longer accessible to the user and can be used by the specific driver for path creation. If false, the channel is considered a standard channel and can be explicitly connected to another channel.
member.remarks: Once a channel has been configured as a configuration channel, then no operation can be performed on that channel, except for reading and writing the Is Configuration Channel property.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchChannel.IsSourceChannel
member.summary: If True, the channel is a source channel. Two channels that are either sources or have their own connections to sources, may not be connected. This prevents connections that might cause damage to channels, devices, or system.
member.remarks: The intention of this property is to prevent channels from being connected that may cause damage to the channels, devices, or system. Notice that GROUND can be considered a source in some circumstances.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchChannel.Characteristics
member.summary: A reference to the class-compliant IIviSwtchCharacteristics interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchChannelCollection
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant channel collection interface

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant channel characteristics interface

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.ACCurrentCarryMax
member.summary: The maximum AC current the channel can carry, in amperes RMS.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.ACCurrentSwitchingMax
member.summary: The maximum AC current the channel can switch, in amperes RMS.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.ACPowerCarryMax
member.summary: The maximum AC power the channel can carry, in volt-amperes.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.ACPowerSwitchingMax
member.summary: The maximum AC power the channel can switch, in volt-amperes.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.ACVoltageMax
member.summary: The maximum AC voltage the channel can handle, in volts RMS.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.Bandwidth
member.summary: The maximum frequency signal, in Hertz, that you can pass through the channel without attenuating it by more than 3dB.
member.remarks: Values for this property are on per-channel basis and may not take into account the other switches that make up a path to or from this channel.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.DCCurrentCarryMax
member.summary: The maximum DC current the channel can carry, in amperes.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.DCCurrentSwitchingMax
member.summary: The maximum DC current the channel can switch, in amperes.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.DCPowerCarryMax
member.summary: The maximum DC power the channel can handle, in watts.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.DCPowerSwitchingMax
member.summary: The maximum DC power the channel can switch, in watts.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.DCVoltageMax
member.summary: The maximum DC voltage the channel can handle, in volts.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.Impedance
member.summary: The characteristic impedance of the channel, in ohms.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.SettlingTime
member.summary: The maximum total settling time for the channel before the signal going through it is considered stable. This includes both the activation time for the channel as well as any debounce time.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchCharacteristics.WireMode
member.summary: The number of conductors in the current channel. Values for this property are on per-channel basis and may not take into account the other switches that make up a path to or from this channel.

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant path interface

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.CanConnect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Without actually creating the path, this reports whether the switch module can create a given path. This method takes existing paths into account.
member.param: A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
member.returns: Indicates whether a path is valid and/or possible. See the spec for definitions

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.Connect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a path between the two channels. If the path already exists, the operation does not count the number of calls. All paths are assumed to be bi-directional.
member.param: A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
A string indicating one of the channels of the path.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.Disconnect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Destroys the path between the two channels. The order of the two channels need not be the same as the connect operation. If no explict path exists between the two channels, this function returns the error No Such Path without performing any disconnection operation
member.param: A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
A string indicating one of the channels of the path.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.DisconnectAll
member.summary: Disconnect all paths created since Initialize or Reset have been called. If any paths remain, this method returns a Path Remains warning.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.GetPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of channels that have been connected in order to create the path between the specified channels. The only valid paths that can be returned are ones that have been explicitly set via Connect and SetPath methods.
member.param: A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
A string indicating one of the channels of the path.
member.returns: An driver-allocated array of channels used to create a path between channel1 and channel 2.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.SetPath(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a path given a pathList of path legs defined by a start and end channel pair. The end channels are the first and last channels in the array. All other channels are intermediate channels. Channels are connected in the order in which they occur in the array.
member.param: Array of channels indicating the path.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.WaitForDebounce(Ivi.Driver.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Wait time until all the signals flowing through the switch have settled. If the signals do not settle within MaxTime, the method returns a Max Time Exceeded error.
member.param: Maximum time to wait for the debounce operation to complete.

member.name: P:Ivi.Swtch.IIviSwtchPath.IsDebounced
member.summary: If True, the switch module has settled from previous switching commands and completed debounce. This indicates that the signal going through the switch module is valid, assuming that the switches in the path have the correct characteristics.

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.IviSwtch
member.summary: The IviSwtch class allows clients to create instances of drivers that implement the class-compliant IviSwtch interfaces, based on information in the IVI configuration store. This allows clients to interchange IVI.NET class-compliant IviSwtch drivers without modifying or rebuilding the client program source code.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IviSwtch.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviSwtch class-compliant driver and return an IIviSwtch reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery and reset parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviSwtch driver to be created.
member.returns: An IIviSwtch interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IviSwtch.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviSwtch class-compliant driver and return an IIviSwtch reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery and reset parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviSwtch driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.
member.returns: An IIviSwtch interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IviSwtch.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviSwtch class-compliant driver and return an IIviSwtch reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery, reset, and options parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviSwtch driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.

A comma-separated list of option assignments. An options assignment has the form "OptionName=Value", where OptionName is one of: 'Cache', 'InterchangeCheck', 'QueryInstrStatus', 'RangeCheck', 'RecordCoercions', 'Simulate', or 'DriverSetup'. With the exception of DriverSetup, all of the options accept values of 'true' or 'false'. 'DriverSetup' is a string, and must be last in the list. The method assumes that everything following 'DriverSetup=' is part of the assignment. The DriverSetup string is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.
member.returns: An IIviSwtch interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.
member.remarks:
Examples of legal values for the options parameter are:
* ""
* "Simulate=true"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,QueryInstrStatus=false"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,DriverSetup=Trace=false"
Note that 'Simulate', 'Cache', and 'QueryInstrStatus' are standard IVI features, while 'Trace=false' is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.

member.name: M:Ivi.Swtch.IviSwtch.Create(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Ivi.Driver.LockType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an IviSwtch class-compliant driver and return an IIviSwtch reference to the caller. The creation process uses the IVI configuration store to map a logical name or driver session name to the main driver class of the corresponding specific driver. The driver is initialized using information from the IVI configuration store and the idQuery, reset, and options parameters.
member.param: An IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name that refers to the IVI.NET class-compliant IviSwtch driver to be created.
If true, verify the ID of the instrument.
If true, reset the instrument.
Specifies whether to use .NET AppDomain-wide locking or machine-wide locking.

Specifies a user-selectable access key to identify the lock. Driver instances that are created with the same accessKey will be protected from simultaneous access by multiple threads within a process or across processes, depending upon the value of the lockType parameter.

A comma-separated list of option assignments. An options assignment has the form "OptionName=Value", where OptionName is one of: 'Cache', 'InterchangeCheck', 'QueryInstrStatus', 'RangeCheck', 'RecordCoercions', 'Simulate', or 'DriverSetup'. With the exception of DriverSetup, all of the options accept values of 'true' or 'false'. 'DriverSetup' is a string, and must be last in the list. The method assumes that everything following 'DriverSetup=' is part of the assignment. The DriverSetup string is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.
member.returns: An IIviSwtch interface reference for the specific driver that is referred to by the provided IVI configuration store logical name or driver session name.
member.remarks:
Examples of legal values for the options parameter are:
* ""
* "Simulate=true"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,QueryInstrStatus=false"
* "Simulate=true,Cache=false,DriverSetup=Trace=false"
Note that 'Simulate', 'Cache', and 'QueryInstrStatus' are standard IVI features, while 'Trace=false' is meaningful only to the specific driver being instantiated.

member.name: T:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability
member.summary: IVI Swtch class-compliant values for PathCapability

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.Available
member.summary: The driver can create a path at this time.

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.Exists
member.summary: The explicit path between the channels already exists.

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.Unsupported
member.summary: Although path is valid, the instrument is not capable of creating a path between the two channels, because the switch module is currently using one or more of the required channels to create another path. You must destroy the other path before creating this one.

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.ResourceInUse
member.summary: Although the path is valid, the driver cannot create the path at this moment because the switch module is currently using one or more of the required channels to create another path. You must destroy the other path before creating this one.

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.SourceConflict
member.summary: The instrument cannot create a path between the two channels because both are connected to a different source channel.

member.name: F:Ivi.Swtch.PathCapability.ChannelNotAvailable
member.summary: The driver cannot create a path between the two channels because one of the channels is a configuration channel and thus unavailable for external connections.
